fields.headline: Burke sees off Thistle
fields.bodyText: Rangers, showing seven changes from Thursday's Uefa Cup win over Sporting Lisbon, eased into the Scottish Cup semi-finals at Partick Thistle's expense yesterday, when goals by Nacho Novo and Chris Burke were sufficient to eliminate the First Division side in a replay at Firhill. Novo slid the ball home from close range after 27 minutes, before Burke headed the second beyond Jonny Tuffey to settle the match. Partick passed up a glorious opportunity to get back into the tie when Simon Donnelly sent a penalty wide. Donnelly later hit the bar, whereas Rangers wasted a spot-kick of their own, Daniel Cousin's casual effort being saved by Tuffey. Rangers now face another First Division team, St Johnstone, at Hampden Park on Sunday.
